abstract: Sergey Brin, a Google co-founder, said Thursday that he has a gene mutation that increases his likelihood of contracting Parkinson’s disease.
snippet: Sergey Brin, a Google co-founder, said Thursday that he has a gene mutation that increases his likelihood of contracting Parkinson’s disease.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Sergey Brin, a Google co-founder, said Thursday that he has a gene mutation that increases his likelihood of contracting Parkinson’s disease, a degenerative disorder of the central nervous system that can impair speech, movement and other functions.

headline.main: Google Co-Founder Has Genetic Code Linked to Parkinson’s
headline.print_headline: Google Co-Founder Has Genetic Code Linked to Parkinson’s

abstract: By blogging about a genetic mutation that increases his risk of contracting Parkinson’s, Sergey Brin may be looking for advice.
snippet: By blogging about a genetic mutation that increases his risk of contracting Parkinson’s, Sergey Brin may be looking for advice.
lead_paragraph: The Google co-founder Sergey Brin on Thursday disclosed that he carried a mutation of a gene known as LRRK2 that gave him a higher-than-average risk of contracting Parkinson’s disease.

headline.main: Why Sergey Brin May Have Disclosed His Risk for Parkinson’s
